conclusion: To determine if objects A and B have the same acceleration at time \( t_1 \), analyze their velocity-time graphs.
Acceleration is the rate of change of velocity with respect to time, determined from the slope of the velocity-time graph.
Identify the slopes at \( t_1 \) for both objects to find their accelerations.
The slope of the velocity-time graph at any point gives the acceleration at that point.
For object A, the slope at \( t_1 \) is the tangent to the curve at that point.
For object B, the slope at \( t_1 \) is the tangent to the curve at that point.
Compare the slopes at \( t_1 \) to determine if accelerations are the same.
At \( t_1 \), observe the steepness of the tangent lines for both objects.
If the slopes are equal, the accelerations are the same.
The tangent to the curve for object A at \( t_1 \) appears steeper than for object B.
This suggests that the acceleration of object A is greater than that of object B at \( t_1 \).
Since the slopes are not the same, the objects do not have the same acceleration at \( t_1 \).
Final answer: No, the two objects do not have the same acceleration at time \( t_1 \).
